page.title: 18Local Geography
page.content: The water table is high in the area and in times past Much Hadham has been subjected to flooding.There are a number of fords in the area but several only have water flowing in times of flood rather than genuine fords. Extensive dredging has been undertaken in 1985, and the flooding problem has hopefully been alleviated. In the last two years there have been cases of river pollution, which on one occasion devastated the stocks of trout at Gingercress Farm south of the village. One of the fords marks the northerly boundary of the block at the hamlet of Hadham Ford where the River Ash crosses the lane from Little Hadham to Much Hadham. Here, several attractive houses line the edge of a small sloping green, on which stands the war memorial.
